column5: Yeah crazy weather this year as far as winter goes.  We've had it pretty mild so far but there's always the cold snap that pops up every now and again     Tomorrow should be alright to venture out on the hard stuff...... will be targeting my favorite walleye lake   But in the mean time, been whittling a wooden project for the past week..... haven't begin the painting stage yet     Will post some pics when I finally finish it  Here's a sneak peek
It's -16c in the wilds of Markham, but I just checked and it's +29 in Cancun - which is where I'm going next month! I just had to say that.
For what it's worth.... have yourself a great trip in Cancun fisherman7
Well its decent in Winnipeg right now but check out where I'm spending next week....  Hall Beach
Yikesssss   :w00t:   Better bring a triple layer of extra clothing for that trip troutologist Good luck and have a safe trip

justed came back from fishing and work.  got a couple of houres this mornning and missed a good size pike.  then did the plumbing in my frineds cottage.  when i was done the whole thing .  fished again for 1 houres landed a hammer handle 2 lbs pike.  i think i have frost bite on the tip of my fingers tho!

I admire your dedication to the sport but for me just too cold to be out there Tomorrow will be a lot better temp wise..... I'm going to St-Marie early morning for some eyes and you are welcome to join.... just let me know, leaving tomorrow at 6:30am

At 6:15 pm in 'Bama it's 32*F, humidity is 73% and we have a N.W. wind @ 10 mph... Ol' Yeller came in from work a couple hours ago just'a squawkin' about how she was frozen to the bone and wants summer to hurry up and get here!... and she's Canadian!!!  It's a wet, bone chilling, retnek kinda cold yanno!
I hear ya Glen   Just reading your reply, I feel a lot better now Wish me luck tomorrow.... going for some golden
GO FOR THE GOLD!!!  Dress warm and don't forget your gloves and toque Jacques!!!
Yes Bubba G..... I will
i admire you love for the sport jaques but tommorow its oging to be to HOT!
NONONO.... think GOLDEN KEV   B) ARE YOU COMING???

Since last Monday night, we have been in -25ish overnight lows to -16ish highs. Colder outside of Thunder Bay. Forecasted to be -22C overnight tonight, feels like -31 with the wind chill. -19C right now, high of -16C forecasted for today. Its not that bad with sunny skies and the wind does not get any more than 10 kmh, but when it gets to 15 kmh, it feels a lot colder.
Since November we have been in -25ish highs. Most times colder a few times warmer.    Currently a balmy -33.

Sounds like a cold spell to me Tom.... hopefully it won't last too long and get back into seasonal temps later on   You must getting anxious to see the temps raise onto teens so that you can go out fishing hey Dave

Jacques, the cold spell started just after christmas into the new year, then warmer temps reaching 0C overnight last sunday, then dipping down last monday to what it is now. Long range forecast looks like a warming trend starting wednesday, for how long, who knows. But, whatever, been dealing with it for many years up here.
Do you really want to know? put it this way, when they say a high of minus 15, Ill put my skates on and give it a whirl till my toes freeze.  About 30 minutes

Over here, it's been pretty warm so far except for the spells..... rivers, Ottawa and Gatineau aren't fully frozen yet in some parts which is really unusual for this time of year.  Today had a good 16"+ of ice on the lake I targeted compared to last week which was 13".  Like you said "who knows" is what we have to deal with so far.  I don't think I would venture out on the big lakes up here simply because I don't know what the ice thickness is with this crazy weather.

You bet!!!! Won't be long  now. I've got some vacation time booked for the end of March beginning of April. A buddy and I are heading to the East arm of Great Slave to try and ice some giant Lakers. My buddy has one of these for us to hold up in when we're not fishing.    We will probably spend a week or so exploring out there and then hit some other big trout lakes when we get bored.
It got up to 59*F for a couple hours here today. There was a piercing northerly breeze on the north side of the house... but the patio on the south side was almost like being in Florida!

Kewl Dave..... That's an awesome chanty your friend has     If I may call it that Good luck with them big lakers!!!   Hope you didn't get a sunburn on the patio Glen     Up here this morning almost got a wind burn on the south side of the lake   Cozy -15C and some snow
Looks like I'm going to be whittling sticks tomorrow
Bout the same here...I'm going snowmobiling...that way the windchill doesn't count
Lucky you...... I ain't stepping outside until maybe Sunday
All I can tell you Jacque, is that I have TWO Napoleon fireplaces stuffed full of Red Oak and Maple and the furnace is still coming on !
:w00t:  So I guess going out for the night bite is out of the question
Naaa.. it's not that cold !  What ya gonna do when winter gets here??
Yeah I know..... we've had pretty mild temps so far..... can't complain but I still hate when it dips to -31C    Sunday should be better, might be going out fishing after all
It's warmed up here. It's a balmy -17c as I type. It was -26 this morning. Typical January weather. I just hope that the ice is off of my lake of choice by May long weekend.
Here in Markham, ON it's around -18, -27 with wind. Dipping down to -22 without wind tomorrow morning......
It supposed to warm up to -6C on Sunday..... I sure hope the weatherman is right this time around Otherwise I'll have to resort to plan B..... the workshop
They're calling for -16C tomorrow during the day..... I'm still going to be whittling sticks
-19C here right now.......
-22 right now in Barrie..  Should be a fun day out on Lake Simcoe tomorrow.
That's not bad.... humidity is the killer..... 53% right now
21 where I'm sitting
Good luck out there tomorrow Bill     Targetting whities??
Yeah me too... nice and causy
weather report is bang on at -17 at 3:15am.think i'll hit the pike on sunday .promises to be a cozy -5  brampton climate.
Good luck on Sunday waterwolf
I'll sit tight and bask in the warmth of the fire today. It was nippy enough on the ice yesterday.  Might have another go tomorrow.
Just about the same here Bruce.... tomorrow will be a better day temp wise

-31 right now in Yellowknife -36 windchill. Too cold for me to go out ice fishing. Could be worse though, it was -49 with no wind before Christmas. I usually don't head out when it's colder than -25. Guess I'm a wuss. I am getting a little ice fishing fix watching Bob Izumi catching bows and brookies through the ice.
:w00t:   Down here it's humidity that's killer.... gone up to 64% I'm same as you, don't go out when it's too cold.  Right now, where I'm sitting it's 22C and I ain't moving
52% humidity here right now so not quite as damp.

We've had a rotten year so far in my area.  Winter came very late.  The Saguenay river does not have much ice and where I set up my fish hut, there is no ice yet and the area is closed.  So far, we got about 1/3 of the normal snow fall.  It's either very cold or too warm with rain.  Been in the - 20's all week.  Should get quite a bit warmer after the weekend.
